Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Travel G
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, the rooms were spacious, the staff were friendly, the breakfast was fresh and delicious and the location was unbeatable for the price. The entrance to the hotel is not traditional. You have to go down a very narrow alley way (about 1 meter wide or less!) and then up some stairs. The hotel is not signed well and yes it's true it is a small laminated sign but who cares what the outside looks like. The photos on here are accurate to what we stayed in. The reception is in the sister hotel just down the street. When you go down the alley then up the stairs the you press an intercom and talk to the reception who direct you where to go to check in. The check in is located in the hotel Antica Casa Carettoni. Remember this and you will love it. This hotel was definitely worth the money (a bargain!). There is not wifi but we were able to purchase some from the next door hotels wifi network hotspot on our credit card for 9 euro (shhhhhh!). There is however an Internet cafe just down the street as well as many restaurants and shops. The boat and train transport are a 1 minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Basic and Clean for a Visit to an Amazing City”
Reviews.Author: Nima002
Reviews.Content: We booked the accommodation whilst in Europe and there wasn't much to choose from in Venice however we didn't have high expectations as the price per night was very cheap. The entrance to the hotel gave us plenty of laughs upon arrival as we were concerned our suitcases would not fit down the alley way to the door. Don't expect a grand entrance as this is unlike any hotel we have ever stayed at. There is no reception and you have to go to another hotel a couple of doors down to check in and get the key to your room. Once inside the room it did smell a little musty and smokey (old cigarette smell), however opening the window to air out the room soon freshened the accommodation. The decor of the room is very dated however the bed linen was clean and the shower was too. As I mentioned at the beginning of this review this is budget accommodation so you cannot expect too much for the price especially for prices this low to stay in an amazing city. You will also realise there is so much to see in Venice that you won't want to stay in any hotel for too long. The location of the hotel is great and close to the train station and water taxi and bus area which makes it easy to travel around.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & good location”
Reviews.Author: Littlecurly
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews on this hotel, I was not looking forward to our 2 nights at Hotel Moderno (the funniest name ever!). Unfortunately there was not much choice in accommodation when we booked so we were stuck. Surprisingly I would have to say, for the only time in Italy, our very low expectations were exceeded! Apart from the check-in process, which was VERY painful with a heavy backpack at 10pm at night, we had no other complaints. Yes the rooms are small, yes it is an old building & yes it feels like you are on a ship. BUT the room was clean, bed was comfortable, aircon worked well, bathroom tidy and smelt clean, location is fantastic & was reasonably priced by Venice standards. TIP: For first-timers to Venice, we would strongly suggest staying on the mainland or a nearby island such as Lido, where you will still be 10 minutes from the action but get MUCH better value for money & less noise from the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Fake Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: uzma2001
Reviews.Content: Oh dear, Hotel Moderno Cannaregio 154 Venice is Fake Hotel, please please do not book this Hotel, I booked this hotel from internet, the way of this hotel is just 14 inches wide, a healthy person cannot enter the main way of hotel, when i reached the hotel, the hotel door was closed, there is bad smell spreading and there was no one for receiving the guest, we were tired after 25 minutes a lady named " Alezia " reached and given the room and gate key and gone xxxxxx WE ASTONISHED. There was no one, no any attendent no manager no cleaner and no any person, even no reception or counter, this is not any hotel this is go down and they are booking in internet in the name of hotel, please visitors do not book this fake hotel, they are liars.........................

Reviews.Title: “Over all terrible, who rated this hotel two star is blind.”
Reviews.Author: Sompheng
Reviews.Content: Terrible over all. Not worth the price at all. It was the most terrible hotel I ever and never wanted to stay. (If you are reading this message, you should get another beter hotel just add 20-30 to get three or four stars hotel, to advoid one night charge for cancel )

Reviews.Title: “Only saving grace of this hotel is the location”
Reviews.Author: DZAmberG
Reviews.Content: We were unpleasantly surprised when we arrived in Venice and found our hotel. The only 'sign' was a laminated sheet of paper with 'Hotel Moderno' and an arrow, stuck up with scotch tape around the edges. The arrow pointed you down a tiny creepy alley. We lugged our bags down there and went up the stairs, only to find out we had to check in at a sister hotel, a few doors down. Hotel and our room were pretty outdated, with carpet on the walls and doors, a couch that could have belonged to my grandmother as a child, and a stained bedspread that also sported a 6 inch gash in the middle of it! Once we stashed the bedspread in a drawer, the place seemed to be decently clean at least. If you can get over all that, it is a great location. In the middle of a lot of shopping and restaurants. Just a few minutes to walk to the train station or water busses. Also close to a great bridge over the grand canal. We stood at the top of that and watched boats and people go by while we ate some dinner a couple nights - which we'd picked up at Quanto Basta - a couple doors down from our hotel. They had pizza and awesome sandwiches with roasted meats and falafel!

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect a miracle, but it's a reasonable value”
Reviews.Author: trobaba
Reviews.Content: The other reviews say it all -- squeeze down a tiny alley, climb the stairs, to find a very basic but clean and functional room, in a convenient location. The Ritz it ain't. Checkin is next door, zero poetry, no service, but if you get it your room for 50 euros or under you are getting an OK deal. Having stayed recently at a fancer hotel in a "better" location (Rialto-San Marco), I would like to point out the advantages of the Moderno's location. You are next to the train station and the vaporetto hub, so that's all good. But I want to praise the neighborhood, Canareggio, which is a real neighborhood and not exclusively tourist oriented like Rialto-San Marco. There is an open air market on the Campo San Leonardo, a 5 minute walk away, and there are neighborhood bars where Venetian townspeople meet to shoot the breeze. The historic Jewish ghetto is a short walk away. Venetian food being generally mediocre and overpriced, you might consider taking at least some of your meals at the nearby Brek cafeteria, where the chow is no worse than elsewhere, but considerably cheaper. Consider all this as you book your room.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive...but best 2 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: SmartTravellerHK
Reviews.Content: There are goods and bads about the hotel...The entrance is very narrow, steep stairs to hotel rooms, breakfast needs to line up...The good is: location is close to the rail & bus station, room is comfortable, bed is big, our room is very quiet, bathroom is nice...

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel- close to the Ryanair Bus Stop!”
Reviews.Author: Abbiekirkham
Reviews.Content: We stayed in "Hotel Moderno" that was actually Hotel Zechinni when you arrived (I think Hotel Moderno had been closed down, as the address that we were given was a boarded up building!) The room was clean with good facilities, make sure you take mosquito repellant though, as i got bitten alive on the first night. It was extremely central, about 5 minutes walk from the bus station if you are going on a Ryanair flight and getting the bus to Venice. Its a two minute walk from St Lucia station, on a main road. The breakfast was not much to talk about. a big jar of chocolate spread and a croissant. The website advertised it as a hot buffet breakfast, which i certainly was not. As always, you get what you pay for, and this a reasonable priced hotel with basic clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Prefectly reasonable”
Reviews.Author: CarmenH1
Reviews.Content: It did take a while to find the hotel moderno, as it went by a different name "Zecchini". The hotel is a short walk from the railway station and the water bus stop. The room was fairly basic, but clean. We stayed during the olympics and you could get Eurosport in the bedrooms. The breakfast was ok, but didn't offer much variety. This hotel is a good choice for a short visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Don,t know what everyone is moaning about”
Reviews.Author: thetorben
Reviews.Content: Great chain of hotels for the price and excelent location near bus station. Moderno is part of Zecchini hotel and rooms are good and clean with new bathrooms Breakfast room is small but if full they invite you into next door hotel Yes alley is small but memorable you are in venice they don,t have much room Basically a great couple of hotels Zecchini and moderno 5 couples stayed 6 in one hotel and 4 in the other ,age range from 30 to 60 and all happy with hotel, if you want to moan go out and buy a small beer you will have plenty to go at with prices from 5 to 15 quid

Reviews.Title: “Four night stay”
Reviews.Author: DiamondHertfordshire
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute booking so had to take what was availble. That said Hotel Moderno was fine. Entrance up an alley which looked a bit off putting - but there are many many hotels similarly sited - up alleys. Have to register in the hotel next door - the Hotel Zecchini. We had a third floor room. Furniture a bit old fashioned but bathroom modern and clean - although the shower isn't great. We visited Venice to see the City and not to spend time in our room other than sleep. Room was clean. Staff friendly and helpful. Breakfast served in the Hotel Zecchini. Small dining room but breakfast was fine - eggs available if required. Hotel well sited. No real complaints. Venice expensive. We found a comparatively inexpensive restaurant just a fe doors away from the hotel - the Brek bar ristorante. Pasta and draft wine at euros 3.30 a carafe. Saw nothing else as inexpensive. If you expect cheap and cheerful you wont be disappointed. If like us you don't spend too much time in your room it is absolutely fine. Enjoy your stay - we did.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think about it.”
Reviews.Author: Tarrega
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel that I have ever stayed in. It was nasty the bed was worn out. The towels looked like they had been used to clean the restaurant downstairs. The room smelled bad. The pillows were old, flat, smelly and gross. This was a cheap hotel, but my best advice is don't stay near the train station. Spend a little extra. Venice is expensive. Plan on spending more on a hotel and stay near rialto or san marco. This hotel is nasty. To get to it you have to slide between two buildings down a very narrow, dirty, smelly, wet alley. I have included a pix of the alley. Trust me splurge or don't go to venice.

Reviews.Title: “decent enough”
Reviews.Author: lah1308
Reviews.Content: booked this through lastminute.com as it was one of the cheapest hotels they had in venice, the location is good although next time i might stay closer to Rialto / San Polo. We stayed in room no. 10 which was the attic before i think, walked up tiny sets of stairs right up into the roof. the rom was tiny but the bathroom was a decent size by 2* standards. was very clean and the staff were friendly enough. the narrow corridor wasnt damp, dark or grotty, it was narrow! but aout 5 metres long and very safe and clean. lots of restaurant nearby including a pizza plac open very late 2 doors down. internet cafe across the road! breakfast was simple but good enough(the scrambled egg was excellent)

Reviews.Title: “just right”
Reviews.Author: genii7
Reviews.Content: Fabulously located hotel, esp. for the price.Clean, friendly price even included breakfast which came as a surprise. Described well, good value 2*hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for low cost”
Reviews.Author: SunseakersLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend break .Although the entrace was a typical venetian alley the room we had on the 3rd top floor was very clean having been reciently decorated and the bathroom was the same with english plumbing. Fantastic value for money .The best thing of all was the large inbuilt air con unit. Reading the other reviews I can only imagine that the lower floors were not as good as ours.

Reviews.Title: “Small but pleasant”
Reviews.Author: DeeDeeLondon
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I found this hotel small, but clean and pleasant. The entrance to the hotel is through a very narrow allyway which is typical of Venice and was a little on the damp side, but what do you expect from a city surrounded by water! We stayed at the very top of the hotel, room 10. The steps leading to the room were a little steep, and would not recommend this particular room to an elderly couple. The location is excellent. We just needed a place to sleep and Hotel Moderno was just that. The hotel staff were helpful and polite. In a nutshell, small, clean, excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “How it got its 2 star rating, we'll never know!”
Reviews.Author: AL76
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. We found our way to the room down a very damp, dark, seedy, alley way. Not the best start! We were put in room 5 but after the first night asked to be moved as it was extremely niosy, very early in the morning from people and businesses on the street below. The room was very very small, with a cupboard for a bathroom, which smelled slightly! They moved us to one of the sister hotels down the road which seemed a little better but we were put into a room next to where they did all the laundrey, which they did advise us of and said it might be niosy during the day. We had an unexpected visit from a local scorpion that evening, which gave us another restless night, incase it's family were visiting as well!! On our third night, which was on our return from 4 days in a beautiful hotel in Lake Garda, we were given the keys to room 4 but asked again if we could be put somewhere off the main street. They put us in one of the rooms above the reception in Hotel Zuccinni which was satisfactory. At least they agreed to move us which they seemed fairly happy to do. If you want budget stay in Hotel Zuccinni but definately not Hotel Moderno!!

Reviews.Title: “eehh”
Reviews.Author: K.B.7
Reviews.Content: This place was allright...nothing too great. In order to get to your room you had to go down a dirty, wet alley...it was gross.

Reviews.Title: “Grotty, hideous hotel with rude staff”
Reviews.Author: welshy78
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel recently when we were on our Honeymoon. Whilst we were initially thrilled that it was so close to the train station (3 mins walk) when we actually set eyes on the outside of this hotel (which is basically a thin alleyway which you carry your suitcase down sideways!) I immediately felt a) claustrophobic - no fire escape - nothing!!! b) scared - no main reception, anyone could just walk off the street and through the door and be practically in your room! I actually cried when I then saw our room, which is totally over the top for me, but it really was THAT bad. Even the towels in the bathroom looked like they had been used to mop up a sewage explosion. This place would only be acceptable if you were on a one night stay and you didn't give a monkeys where you lay your head (and if you had no belongings that you wished to keep safe, as I really didn't think it was very secure) Horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs for breakfast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is terrible. I spent the whole night fighting off bed bugs and lost. The hotel has bad smell and the room is tiny and cramped. The buffet breakfast, which was described as "sumptuous", was pathetic. Three small slices of bread and crappy biscuits between two people, which wasn't so bad in the end as there was practically nothing worthwhile to eat the bread with anyway. The only thing going for this hotel is that it is close to the train station, making it easy beat a hasty escape. I left a day early and was glad to pay for the day thrown away just to be able to stay elsewhere. Btw, the hotel doesn't accept payment by credit cards. Cash only.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were delighted that the hotel is a 2 minute walk from the Train station along the main street. This is especially helpful when you are lugging large bags and are tired from a long train ride. Upon arrival it is funky, as the Hotel Moderno does not have its own lobby, instead you must go to the lobby of the hotel to the left i think its Hotel Zuchinni or similar. We missed the small note on the door and walked up the stairs only to be greeted by a locked door. The room was small but it is to be expected in Europe. Our rooms was somewhat slanted, a feature we couldnt figure out but something we could live with. The male receptionist was not very friendly but the ones we met after him were. Location was not a problem as we were steps from the grand canal and you can either take a water taxi or walk it about 40 minutes to St. Marks plaza where you will find vendors and stores along the way. We never took the water busses as the walk was not bad at all and you are able to experience and wander through the city. As long as you stick to the signs which are posted on buildings that tell you which way to go to certain landmarks and tourist sites you should be okay. The only negaitve would be the lackluster breakfast which is almost not even worth your time to go to. Also right underneath the hotel is a internet cafe/disco that plays loud music and taints your room with voices and arguments throughout the night. Nothing special but also nothing terribly wrong with our stay here, i would defintely come back again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Moderno
HotelInfo.Address: Cannaregio 154 | Cannaregio, 30121 Venice, Italy
